item.title: Review of Research Paper: 'Pubertal Suppression for Transgender Youth and Risk of Suicidal Ideation'
item.description: This post reviews the paper ‘Pubertal Suppression for Transgender Youth and Risk of Suicidal Ideation’, one of the primary scientific papers supporting the use of drugs to inhibit the progress of puberty in children. This research is winner of the American Academy of Pediatrics ‘Paper of the Year’ award, 2020, and is cited 104 times; thereby, lending large credence to its conclusions. The review focuses on the paper’s quality of data, arguments made by the authors, and statistical results used to support the arguments.
